AD_ZrellWaiting.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_ZrellWaiting.text: If so much as a rat crosses that bridge, cut its throat.

PAD_Use.speaker: Narrator
PAD_Use.text: *From this seat, Ketheric defied gods and raised an army for the Absolute.*
PAD_Use.context: CinematicNodeContext: Grand shot of Ketheric's hall over the player's shoulder.

PAD_Use.speaker: Player
PAD_Use.text: Don't get used to it. One taste of regal power might have you craving more.

AD_WithGuard001.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_WithGuard001.text: All quiet? Do you suppose the Absolute's enemies are resting, soldier?
AD_WithGuard001.context: NodeContext: Suddenly cutting, questioning - poking at her underling's complacency.

AD_WithGuard001.speaker: Zealot Bennel
AD_WithGuard001.context: NodeContext: Taken aback at her ferocity

AD_WithGuard001.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_WithGuard001.text: Perhaps you cannot find them - root them out - because they are your allies? Hm?

AD_WithGuard001.speaker: Zealot Bennel
AD_WithGuard001.text: I - no, mistress! I  would never -
AD_WithGuard001.context: NodeContext: Close to pleading - is cut off by Z'rell at the end.

AD_WithGuard001.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_WithGuard001.text: Oh, relax and let me have my fun. This paperwork grows tedious.
AD_WithGuard001.context: NodeContext: Chuckling, suddenly breaking tension. A cruel boss mocking an underling for 'not taking a joke'.

FlamingSpy.speaker: Fist Marcus
FlamingSpy.text: My unexpected ally! The General was very pleased with Isobel's return. Don't worry, I told him all about you.
FlamingSpy.context: NodeContext: genuine in the first line, but in the second he sounds smug (he totally took all the credit)

Ogre.speaker: Glourik
Ogre.context: NodeContext: Finger wagging, chiding like a child

AD_WithCultist.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_WithCultist.text: Ensure that the Moonlanterns outside are maintained, too. The curse cannot be allowed to touch the Absolute's hall.
AD_WithCultist.context: NodeContext: A superior giving orders, just to assert her authority - fiery, dangerous, spitting

AD_WithCultist.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_WithCultist.context: NodeContext: Sharp correction - and underling dared call her by her first name, not her title

AD_WithSpy.speaker: Fist Marcus
AD_WithSpy.text: I am free to do more for the Absolute, Disciple. Anything.
AD_WithSpy.context: NodeContext: A terse religious greeting - a better to an underling, annoyed to be speaking to a lower rank

AD_WithSpy.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_WithSpy.text: Would you cast yourself from the tower-top?

AD_WithSpy.speaker: Fist Marcus
AD_WithSpy.text: Of course. I have the Absolute's wings to catch me.

AD_WithSpy.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_WithSpy.text: Off you go, then. I've always wanted to try those ballistas.

DaisyAD_AttackImmortal.text: He cannot die - we must find what gives him his invulnerability before we strike!

DaisyAD_AttackImmortalRepeated.text: It won't work - not until we find out what is keeping him from death!

PAD_Entry.speaker: Player
PAD_Entry.text: Every bit as disgusting as the first time.

PAD_ColonyComment.speaker: Player
PAD_ColonyComment.text: Look - there's something on the other side. No way through from here though.

CorpseMembranes_Dead.speaker: Narrator
CorpseMembranes_Dead.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

PAD_Escape.speaker: Player
PAD_Escape.text: The stink of that place might never wash out.

AD_Minthara_EnteredNecromancerRoom.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_Minthara_EnteredNecromancerRoom.text: Balthazar's chamber. Digging through the offal is unappealing, but may be worthwhile.

Skeletons.speaker: Narrator
Skeletons.text: *You think you hear a whisper - but perhaps it was just wind draughting through a dull and empty thing.*
Skeletons.context: NodeContext: Not sure if "draughting" is correct usage but feels good for this moment - creepy wind creepily sighing through a creepy skeleton

PAD_TownVista.speaker: Player
PAD_TownVista.text: This must have been quite a view, once.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: I've heard a great deal about you, True Soul.
Ketheric.context: InternalNodeContext: NS captured but Isobel not captured

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: Indeed, I'd have thrown you off this tower by now if I didn't want to have a little chat first.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: You've travelled a long way to make it this far. Lied. Fought. Killed.

Ketheric.speaker: Player
Ketheric.text: I'd do whatever it takes to gain an audience with the Absolute.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: And yet Isobel - the Selûnite cleric - is nowhere to be found. Z'rell instructed you quite clearly.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: Who are you to defy the Absolute's orders? My orders?

Ketheric.speaker: Player
Ketheric.text: I brought you the Nightsong - just as you asked.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: Half marks means you fail, True Soul.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: The Absolute will decide your fate.
Ketheric.context: NodeContext: Dismissive, like an extremely disappointed parent

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.text: Kneel before the Absolute's altar. Throw yourself at Her mercy. Or try to earn Her forgiveness by retrieving the cleric Isobel. Your choice.

Ketheric.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
Ketheric.context: NodeContext: Almost sarcastic, like a very annoyed child talking to their parent

AD_MumblingSul.speaker: Pilgrim Sul
AD_MumblingSul.text: Cleric of the moon, alas! Too soon for the Chosen.

RoofTransgression.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
RoofTransgression.text: Curious. I believe you were told to wait.

RoofTransgression.speaker: Player
RoofTransgression.text: My apologies, General. Please forgive my intrusion.

RoofTransgression.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
RoofTransgression.text: It isn't for me to forgive one who so flouts the Absolute's will.

RoofTransgression.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
RoofTransgression.text: It is for me to punish them.

AccessCultist.speaker: Radija
AccessCultist.text: It is not your time yet, blessed one.
AccessCultist.context: NodeContext: Looking us up and down, unimpressed but (barely) polite. Main note for entire dialogue is a customer service worker who knows they have to be polite, but secretly hates you.

AccessCultist.speaker: Radija
AccessCultist.text: The rooftop chapel is reserved for the General's private contemplation - save for those he chooses to ascend.
AccessCultist.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of the doorsNodeContext: Polite facade, but secretly enjoying telling us we're not so special

AccessCultist.text: This must be the place. We have to get inside.

AccessCultist.speaker: Player
AccessCultist.text: I've heard that those lucky few come back changed.

AccessCultist.speaker: Radija
AccessCultist.text: You are already changed, True Soul. Hearing Her voice is what brought you here.
AccessCultist.context: NodeContext: Nodding, but unimpressed by our pulling rank. She's about to explain that being a True Soul is not special in her eyes

AccessCultist.speaker: Radija
AccessCultist.text: But above, you will stand in Her very presence. Such an honour requires... more.

AccessCultist.speaker: Narrator
AccessCultist.text: *Her words are diplomatic, but her face betrays her true feelings: utter contempt, for you and all your kind.*

AccessCultist.speaker: Radija
AccessCultist.text: Disciple Z'rell has given you a chance to earn that honour.
AccessCultist.context: NodeContext: Fixed smile, a little patronising

AccessCultist.speaker: Radija
AccessCultist.text: I believe you will find your rightful place in Her design. Either you will ascend, or you will fall.
AccessCultist.context: NodeContext: Neutral - this could be reassurance or threat

AccessCultist.speaker: Radija
AccessCultist.text: And I find use for even the fallen. I hope that is some comfort to you.
AccessCultist.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of skeletons standing guardNodeContext: Indicating the skeletons she's revived

PAD_FeelingSick.speaker: Player
PAD_FeelingSick.text: Ugh. That potion... did not go down well.

AD_Minthara_EnteredKethericRoom.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_Minthara_EnteredKethericRoom.text: This is where the great General Thorm rests his bones? We should ransack it.

LoneUnwelcomeTowerVisitorApproach.speaker: Narrator
LoneUnwelcomeTowerVisitorApproach.text: *The cult know you live, but believe you to be a thrall, with your mind erased. Best not be seen here without one of your tadpoled companions.*

LoneUnwelcomeTowerVisitorApproach.speaker: Player
LoneUnwelcomeTowerVisitorApproach.text: Prepare to push onwards into Moonrise, whatever the risk.

AD_PrisonComment.speaker: Sentient Amulet
AD_PrisonComment.text: Hohohoooo! Conditions most grim, courtesy of Ketheric Thorm.

PAD_ReadWifesNote.speaker: Player
PAD_ReadWifesNote.text: A letter from Ketheric's wife. Sounds like she loved him very much.

AD_Minthara_EnteredLibrary.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_Minthara_EnteredLibrary.text: Security is tight here. Z'rell made this library her command post.

PAD_SharranObservation.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_SharranObservation.text: There is nothing Sharran about this man. He has betrayed the Dark Lady.

Zhent02.speaker: Yerle
Zhent02.text: Ain't looking to convert, True Soul. Gods mind their mess, I mind mine.
Zhent02.context: NodeContext: Respectful but flat refusal - most Absolutists want to convert others, and she's pre-empting it.

AD_Pilgrims.speaker: Pilgrim Taima
AD_Pilgrims.text: To stand this close to Her power... I never thought I'd make it.

AD_Pilgrims.speaker: Pilgrim Iong
AD_Pilgrims.text: I wouldn't have, if not for the lantern-bearer. To think the Absolute graces such a creature as that...

AD_Pilgrims.speaker: Pilgrim Farimorn
AD_Pilgrims.text: We are each of us threads in Her design. Even those we once called monsters.

AD_BugbearThrow.speaker: Lann Tarv
AD_BugbearThrow.text: I could hit a pixie from a hundred paces.
AD_BugbearThrow.context: NodeContext: congratulating himself on a well-thrown axe, while practicing

BazaarStander_006.speaker: Pilgrim Nalira
BazaarStander_006.text: The prisoners below are gone, True Soul. I cannot understand why they would flee Her mercy.
BazaarStander_006.context: InternalNodeContext: The prisoners successfully escaped from Moonrise's dungeons (perhaps all, perhaps only one)NodeContext: Confused, hurt - prisoners in the cell escaped - she saw them as heathens her church was trying to 'save'

BazaarStander_007.speaker: Pilgrim Taima
BazaarStander_007.text: I hear you've been summoned for an audience with Her. You will return changed, I'm sure of it.
BazaarStander_007.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.NodeContext: Wishing us well - we're about to get our 'reward'

Guard01.speaker: Adept Furek
Guard01.text: You should go through the main hall. Witnessing the General's justice is an honour.

Bystander01.speaker: Brawler Weneg
Bystander01.text: Heard a rumour some do-gooder stopped a horde of Absolutists from getting their hands on a load of druids in some grove.

Bystander01.speaker: Brawler Weneg
Bystander01.text: Whoever it was better pray the General doesn't smoke 'em out. Be a bloodbath, so it would.

Bystander00.speaker: Brawler Orik
Bystander00.text: You're the best True Soul I ever met.

Guard00.speaker: Adept Dorikel
Guard00.text: I saw it, True Soul. The army. They're nearly ready. It's nearly time.

Guard00.speaker: Player
Guard00.text: And when the hour draws near...?

AD_GoblinsListening.speaker: Brawler Weneg
AD_GoblinsListening.text: Enough! Just leave the bloody True Souls to their business.

AD_GoblinsListening.speaker: Brawler Wim
AD_GoblinsListening.text: And what's to say that couldn't be us? They say the General rewards them as serve him well.

AD_GoblinsListening.speaker: Brawler Orik
AD_GoblinsListening.text: And what about them who hang around his door like a bad smell?

AD_BazEntranceGuard_002.speaker: Zealot Brinn
AD_BazEntranceGuard_002.text: Another True Soul. The Disciple will want to see you - through the main doors.

AD_Minthara_BazaarEntry.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_Minthara_BazaarEntry.text: Converts, pilgrims, mercenaries. They all seek power, but will find only death.

Bystander03.speaker: Pilgrim Sul
Bystander03.text: She sees everything we are, do you understand? There is no hiding from Her!

Bystander02.speaker: Brawler Wim
Bystander02.text: We ought to head out now - burn everything between here and the city.

AD_GoblinsAfterExecution.speaker: Brawler Orik
AD_GoblinsAfterExecution.text: They bloody killed 'em. What now? Are we next?

AD_GoblinsAfterExecution.speaker: Brawler Wim
AD_GoblinsAfterExecution.text: Not if you keep them lips clapped together.
AD_GoblinsAfterExecution.context: NodeContext: Low and urgent - hushing loud comrade.

AD_GoblinsAfterExecution.speaker: Brawler Weneg
AD_GoblinsAfterExecution.text: Quiet, both of yas! Ye're drawin' attention.

Zhent00.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00.text: Ah, a new face come to bask in the light of the Absolute. How can I be of service, True Soul?

Zhent00.speaker: Player
Zhent00.text: 'New face'? We've met before - at the goblin camp.

Zhent00.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00.text: ...of course! Just before some godless lunatic purged the place of every innocent soul.

Zhent00.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00.text: A pity neither of us saw what happened.

Zhent00.speaker: Player
Zhent00.text: Careful. That sounds like an accusation.

Zhent00.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00.text: The guilty ear hears blame in every breath. But you're among friends here, True Soul.

Zhent00.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00.text: Look around. All manner of beasties united against the enemies of the Absolute.

Zhent00.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00.text: Quite a god to bring them all together. And quite a fool who'd draw their ire, hm?

Zhent00.speaker: Player
Zhent00.text: Drop the act. What are you actually doing here?

Zhent00.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00.text: I'm not the one putting on an act, True Soul.  Though I'd mind how well you mouth your prayers.

Zhent00.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00.text: Spend enough time in this place, and you might just start to believe them.

Zhent00.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Zhent00.text: But look at me preaching, and when I'm only here to serve. Anything to trade, True Soul?

AD_ZhentarimCrew.speaker: Yerle
AD_ZhentarimCrew.text: You sure you don't want me to check those crates? Be nice to know what we're shipping.
AD_ZhentarimCrew.context: NodeContext: Picking up a topic they've clearly already discussed. Her boss is doing a deal and she doesn't like being in the dark

AD_ZhentarimCrew.speaker: Roah Moonglow
AD_ZhentarimCrew.text: Erna, remind your sister why I pay you both so much.
AD_ZhentarimCrew.context: NodeContext: Maintaining a smiling facade. Asking one of her bodyguards to explain to the other why they shouldn't ask questions.

AD_ZhentarimCrew.speaker: Erna
AD_ZhentarimCrew.context: NodeContext: Bored, reciting as if she's had to do it a dozen times before

BazaarStander_005.speaker: Pilgrim Farimorn
BazaarStander_005.text: Blessings, True Soul. We're to march soon - thanks to you.
BazaarStander_005.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.NodeContext: Awed by you

Zhent01.speaker: Erna
Zhent01.text: You trying to get me in trouble?
Zhent01.context: NodeContext: Smiling but fobbing us off.

Bystander04.speaker: Pilgrim Iong
Bystander04.text: The Disciple has returned upstairs but... perhaps she'll still see me.
Bystander04.context: NodeContext: Wants to go, psyching himself up a bit. Now he has his chance and he's a bit scared

AD_Minthara_ThroneRoomEntered.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_Minthara_ThroneRoomEntered.text: I'll never forget how Ketheric humiliated me here.

DaisyAD_Audience.text: There can be no doubt. This is the place. This is where we'll discover the secret of the Absolute.

AD_BackToWork.speaker: Linsella
AD_BackToWork.text: You boys are very good with those cleavers. Something tells me you've had the practice, hm?

GnollMaster.speaker: Linsella
GnollMaster.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mid-conversation with a gnoll, holds up hand to us as we approach

GnollMaster.speaker: Linsella
GnollMaster.text: You use a spoon to stir the soup, Barnabus. Forget the axe, my darling.
GnollMaster.context: NodeContext: Kindly - speaking to a favourite child that is none too bright

GnollMaster.speaker: 'Barnabus'
GnollMaster.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gnoll tilts its head and nods.NodeContext: Gnolls make hyena noises - this is a soft sound of acknowledgement/comprehension. Tilting its head and nodding.

GnollMaster.speaker: Linsella
GnollMaster.text: Now! How can I help you?
GnollMaster.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns back to usNodeContext: Chipper, friendly

MasterGrieving.speaker: Linsella
MasterGrieving.text: Poor Barnabus. I'll have to find another favourite.
MasterGrieving.context: NodeContext: Genuinely sad. Her favourite 'pet' gnoll died.

AD_FoodPrepComment.speaker: Linsella
AD_FoodPrepComment.text: Much better, Tomelia! A little bloody for our tastes, but you're getting there.

CellarMaster.context: CinematicNodeContext: A male drow paces back and forth, practicing strikes and slashes at thin air with a pair of cruel-looking short swords. On closer inspection, it seems that they’re actually grafted onto the stumps of his forearms. He performs a quick flurry of strikes at an imaginary enemy.

CellarMaster.speaker: 21fd5b99-56df-4c59-be68-ed1d2c8e2aa6
CellarMaster.text: Stop. None but those destined for Illumination are allowed to pass me, with Chosen Ketheric's blessing.
CellarMaster.context: CinematicNodeContext: The drow spots the player and scowls.NodeContext: Arrogant

CellarMaster.speaker: 21fd5b99-56df-4c59-be68-ed1d2c8e2aa6
CellarMaster.text: Warriors, nobility, power brokers... important people. Those the Absolute has use for.
CellarMaster.context: CinematicNodeContext: He studies the player critically, then shoos them away with a bladed arm.

CellarMaster.speaker: 21fd5b99-56df-4c59-be68-ed1d2c8e2aa6
CellarMaster.text: You are not among them. Leave.
CellarMaster.context: CinematicNodeContext: Glances over the player critically.

CellarMaster.speaker: Player
CellarMaster.text: Curious. I thought male drow were nothing but cup-bearers and foot-stools.

CellarMaster.speaker: 21fd5b99-56df-4c59-be68-ed1d2c8e2aa6
CellarMaster.text: I serve no one but the Absolute. He trusts me. He honours me.
CellarMaster.context: CinematicNodeContext: His scowl tightens.NodeContext: Proud and self-serious

Jailbreak_AD_SpottedMissingPrisoners.text: Get the Warden - the prisoners have escaped!

General_SpottedUnwelcomeVisitors.speaker: Narrator
General_SpottedUnwelcomeVisitors.text: *You're not welcome in Moonrise, and your presence hasn't gone unnoticed. Time to fight... or flee.*

AD_AccessCultistPrayer.speaker: Radija
AD_AccessCultistPrayer.text: Many hearts, one soul. In Your name, Absolute.

TrespassWarning.speaker: Zealot Klen
TrespassWarning.text: Halt. I know neither your stride nor your bearing.

TrespassWarning.speaker: Fist Marcus
TrespassWarning.text: Stand down, on the General's orders. This one may seek the audience of their choosing.

TrespassWarning.speaker: Zealot Klen
TrespassWarning.text: Very well - if the General wishes.

Guard02.speaker: Zealot Klen
Guard02.text: Congratulations, True Soul. You'll surely be granted an audience - with Her.
Guard02.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.NodeContext: barely contained excitement - the 'Her' is a reference to their god, the Absolute

AD_ImpatientGuards.speaker: Acolyte Daine
AD_ImpatientGuards.text: Ugh. There's blood on these cards.
AD_ImpatientGuards.context: NodeContext: After noticing some gore on her cards

AD_ImpatientGuards.speaker: Zealot Bennel
AD_ImpatientGuards.text: Aye. My brother's. Had to deal with him after he struck a True Soul - claimed she was some kind of monster.
AD_ImpatientGuards.context: NodeContext: Mild, barely looking up from his hand

AD_ImpatientGuards.speaker: Zealot Bennel
AD_ImpatientGuards.text: Had to toss him over that terrace there.
AD_ImpatientGuards.context: NodeContext: Only the vaguest regret - as if murdering his own brother was an unfortunate duty

AD_ImpatientGuards.speaker: Acolyte Daine
AD_ImpatientGuards.context: NodeContext: Mute shock at what she's just heard

AD_ImpatientGuards.speaker: Zealot Bennel
AD_ImpatientGuards.text: God. We belong to just the one now, remember.
AD_ImpatientGuards.context: NodeContext: First edge in his voice. Firmly clarifying that he won't brook any blasphemy against his god

AD_Combat.speaker: Lann Tarv
AD_Combat.context: NodeContext: Entering combat with relish - he was extremely bored

AD_DUBackgroundBook.text: Tendays of dissections of a still-living victim.

Guard01.speaker: Acolyte Kimmeral
Guard01.text: Don't mind Mig and her 'meat sounds'. It's just her brain slopping around in her skull.
Guard01.context: NodeContext: Mig is an ogre complaining about 'meat sounds' - you are reluctantly sharing a room with the ogre, and explaining his weirdness away

Guard02.speaker: Zealot Iogar
Guard02.text: You'd find better lodgings out in the war camp, True Soul.

Guard02.speaker: Zealot Iogar
Guard02.text: I know we're all one under the Absolute, but you do not want to bunk with an ogre.
Guard02.context: NodeContext: Emphatic - this guard has seen things

Guard_003.speaker: Zealot Falla
Guard_003.context: InternalNodeContext: General fallback nodes where none of the above apply. Almost ALWAYS comes after Execution state (directly above)NodeContext: a blessing / saying in their church

Guard_002.speaker: Zealot Niram
Guard_002.text: To the city, True Soul! The waiting's done.
Guard_002.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.NodeContext: Quietly fanatic - can't wait to march

AD_DarraPlea.speaker: Darra
AD_DarraPlea.context: NodeContext: a plea to nobody in particular

Guard_005.speaker: Adept Nola
Guard_005.context: InternalNodeContext: General fallback nodes where none of the above apply. Almost ALWAYS comes after Execution state (directly above)NodeContext: Disgruntled, wants to get on her with work

Guard_004.speaker: Zealot Munish
Guard_004.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has helped Balthazar (and this Nightsong) return to Moonrise. He's down in the Colony.NodeContext: Blessing

AD_SazzaPlea.speaker: Sazza
AD_SazzaPlea.text: I didn't survive mad druids and hungry spiders to die here.

CombatInterruption.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
CombatInterruption.text: What is your name, True Soul?

CombatInterruption.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
CombatInterruption.text: I suppose it doesn't. Z'rell: Kill this fool.
CombatInterruption.context: NodeContext: Maybe a bit of comedy here. 'Funny' (stern). 'And sad' (mockery). 'Zrel: kill him' (dead seriousness)

Guard_006.speaker: Zealot Rylveth
Guard_006.text: I swore myself to Lolth for years. But she never let me sack a city.
Guard_006.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has kidnapped Isobel and helped return Nightsong and Balthazar to Moonrise. The army of the Absolute is ready to march.NodeContext: Looking forward to the fight to come

Guard_001.speaker: Adept Mola
Guard_001.text: The General's advisor is back. Anyone left in the cells better start praying.
Guard_001.context: InternalNodeContext: The player has helped Balthazar (and this Nightsong) return to Moonrise. He's down in the Colony.NodeContext: Almost pities the  prisoners - the man he speaks of loves toying with prisoners

AD_FezzerkPlea.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_FezzerkPlea.text: I don't know nothing about any of this.

AD_Bark.speaker: Squire
AD_Bark.context: NodeContext: Calling guards down on us

Circle.speaker: Narrator
Circle.text: *Carved into the bench's rotted surface are strange, half-faded sigils. A magic circle of some kind, thick with darkness and decay.*
Circle.context: CinematicNodeContext: A shot of the sigil on the desk. It looks dark, evil, unsettling...

Circle.speaker: Gale
Circle.text: A ritual circle... and a complex one, at that. I've seen such a construction before, in the writings of the Weavepasha of Almraiven, though his vision was not so... tainted.

Circle.speaker: Gale
Circle.text: It's inert, if that's what you mean. But it still reeks of the Shadow Weave, and its polluting magic will continue to escape for as long as it lies abandoned here.

Circle.speaker: Gale
Circle.text: The discarded pixie corpses might still contain enough essence, and with one of the broken lantern casements...
Circle.context: NodeContext: Talking himself through an idea.Temptation building, he'd quite like to do this

Circle.speaker: Gale
Circle.text: Yes, I think I'd be able to craft one more lantern. And with a slight modification of the casting gesture, it might be able to wield the shadows instead of repelling them...
Circle.context: NodeContext: Talking himself through an idea.Temptation building, he'd quite like to do this

Circle.speaker: Gale
Circle.text: Though... Mystra's eyes may be upon me, and she'd forbid me dabbling with such magic. She'd want it destroyed. Wasted, arguably.
Circle.context: NodeContext: Coming back to himself after getting carried away, remembering he might get in trouble for creating the lantern. A hint he'd like you to encourage him to use it.

Circle.speaker: Shadowheart
Circle.text: Forget what Mystra wants - think about yourself, and what Lady Shar's power could do for you, Gale. Make the Lantern - spread her will.
Circle.context: NodeContext: 'And rightly so' = SH turned from Shar. 'Forget what Mystra wants' = SH loyal to Shar.

Circle.speaker: Player
Circle.text: Let me deal with the circle.

Circle.speaker: Gale
Circle.text: Deal with it how? I hate to pull rank, but I was once Mystra's Chosen. Destroying magic like this was my bread and butter.

Circle.speaker: Gale
Circle.text: Or did you wish to use it? I assure you - it's pointless. You'll have nothing more than a sore head and a very dissatisfied wizard to show for it.

Circle.speaker: Player
Circle.text: There's a reason you're Mystra's former Chosen. So let me handle it.

Circle.speaker: Gale
Circle.text: Oh, charming. I hope the Shadow Weave was to blame for that little outburst of unwarranted discourtesy.

Circle.speaker: Gale
Circle.text: If you think you know best, go right ahead.
Circle.context: NodeContext: Peeved, ready to let you mess it up

AD_Minthara_EnteredIsobelRoom.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_Minthara_EnteredIsobelRoom.text: This chamber is unlike the others here - it does not reek of death.

AD_MelodiaThorm.speaker: Narrator
AD_MelodiaThorm.text: *Melodia Thorm, loving mother, beloved wife. Her light will never be forgotten.*

Jailbreak_SpeakToPrisonerCrime.speaker: Narrator
Jailbreak_SpeakToPrisonerCrime.text: *Your conversation has been cut short. These prisoners are for Disciple Balthazar's attention only.*

Jailbreak_SpeakToPrisonerCrime.speaker: Player
Jailbreak_SpeakToPrisonerCrime.text: What are the prisoners going to do? Talk me to death?

Jailbreak_SpeakToPrisonerCrime.speaker: Narrator
Jailbreak_SpeakToPrisonerCrime.text: *Your reasoning is hard to argue with. You're free to speak to the prisoners.*

MintharaFate_SpottedWithMinthara.speaker: Narrator
MintharaFate_SpottedWithMinthara.text: *Minthara is supposed to be in a cell - you have some explaining to do.*

MintharaFate_SpottedWithMinthara.speaker: Player
MintharaFate_SpottedWithMinthara.text: I think she serves rather well as my personal servant, don't you?

MintharaFate_SpottedWithMinthara.speaker: Narrator
MintharaFate_SpottedWithMinthara.text: *The guard is happy to let you pass - Minthara is rather less happy about your choice of words.*

PAD_NightsongInfo.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongInfo.text: This Nightsong sounds like the source of Ketheric's immortality.

PAD_NightsongInfo.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongInfo.text: 'Nightsong' - not exactly a name I'd associate with the Absolute.

PAD_NightsongInfo.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongInfo.text: If we find it, maybe we can turn it against him?

PAD_NightsongInfo.speaker: Player
PAD_NightsongInfo.text: If we find it. I doubt he's just left it lying around.

Eye.speaker: Narrator
Eye.text: *The eye focuses on you, taking in every detail of your appearance.*

PAD_Ritual.speaker: Player
PAD_Ritual.text: Ketheric's been studying something called the Apostle... but of which god?

PAD_ApproachingPrisoners.speaker: Player
PAD_ApproachingPrisoners.text: Prisoners. I doubt they'll last long in here.

PAD_ApproachingPrisoners.speaker: Player
PAD_ApproachingPrisoners.text: Careful. One wrong move and we'll be behind bars with them.

AD_FlirtyTiefling.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_FlirtyTiefling.context: NodeContext: leaving without the player, broken hearted and filled with regret

AD_TieflingsFreed.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_TieflingsFreed.context: NodeContext: yelling with authority and confidence

AD_TieflingInspection.speaker: The Warden
AD_TieflingInspection.text: You're lucky, you know. It's rare that Disciple Balthazar takes a personal interest in prisoners.
AD_TieflingInspection.context: NodeContext: smirking as she speaks to her prisoners - cruel

AD_TieflingInspection.speaker: Cal
AD_TieflingInspection.text: You know, the rest I can understand, but you're one of us.

AD_TieflingInspection.speaker: The Warden
AD_TieflingInspection.text: I am not one of you. Elturel proved what we knew all along - these horns and tail are a curse.
AD_TieflingInspection.context: NodeContext: determined and authorative - trying to make her fellow tieflings see the power of the absolute

AD_TieflingInspection.speaker: The Warden
AD_TieflingInspection.text: The Absolute gave me a new name, a new life. She can do the same for you.
AD_TieflingInspection.context: NodeContext: determined and authorative - trying to make her fellow tieflings see the power of the absolute

AD_GnomesInJail.speaker: Nickels
AD_GnomesInJail.text: The stone - I feel it. Hollow behind the back wall, and beyond... water?
AD_GnomesInJail.context: NodeContext: eyes closed, using the stone around him to sense the world beyond his cell

AD_GnomesInJail.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_GnomesInJail.text: I'd bet my last copper there's a pier nearby.

AD_GnomesInJail.speaker: Nimble
AD_GnomesInJail.text: This could be our chance, sir.

ProdigyBrother.speaker: Cal
ProdigyBrother.text: Don't talk to us. You're just making it worse.
ProdigyBrother.context: NodeContext: player has refused to help you - furious

AD_ProdigiesInJail.speaker: Lia
AD_ProdigiesInJail.text: I'll get us out of here, Cal - even if I need to kill every bastard in this hellspit.

AD_ProdigiesInJail.speaker: Cal
AD_ProdigiesInJail.text: I know. And I'll be right alongside you if it comes to that.
AD_ProdigiesInJail.context: NodeContext: knows his sister would give her life for him, feels the same about her

AD_ProdigiesInJail.speaker: Lia
AD_ProdigiesInJail.text: We won't let them win. Not now, not ever.

AD_WardenInspection.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_WardenInspection.text: I'll die before I submit to you, or your pitiful god.

AD_WardenInspection.speaker: The Warden
AD_WardenInspection.text: You're not dying, Wulbren - not for a long, long time.
AD_WardenInspection.context: NodeContext: threatening a prisoner with a cold, cruel smile

AD_WardenInspection.speaker: The Warden
AD_WardenInspection.text: Extremeties, even organs, can all be removed - piece by piece, yet still you'll breathe.
AD_WardenInspection.context: NodeContext: threatening a prisoner with a cold, cruel smile

AD_WardenInspection.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_WardenInspection.text: I... bet you use that line a lot.
AD_WardenInspection.context: NodeContext: flustered and scared as he tries to be brave during an interrogation

AD_WardenInspection.speaker: The Warden
AD_WardenInspection.text: I do. And every, single time, the prisoner cries out for the Absolute - right before they die. You will be no different, little Wulbren.
AD_WardenInspection.context: NodeContext: threatening a prisoner with a cold, cruel smile

AD_ToolAccepted.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_ToolAccepted.context: NodeContext: Assured - player has done has wulbren asked (because why would they do anything else?)

AD_WaitingForGnomes.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_WaitingForGnomes.text: Shh. Not a word - the gnomes are on their way.
AD_WaitingForGnomes.context: NodeContext: Quiet, hushed, determined (about to escape the prison)

Guard_004.speaker: Zealot Nadi
Guard_004.text: Don't speak to the prisoners. The Absolute forbids it.

GnomePrisoner_002.speaker: Nickels
GnomePrisoner_002.text: Nimble said to close my eyes. But I can hear it - the stone is screaming.

Boat.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Boat.text: There's no time! I'm leaving - hold them off.
Boat.context: NodeContext: Yelling. Authorative and grave - he's about to flee while the player fights enemies off

Boat.speaker: Player
Boat.text: I will not fall in battle - we will meet again.

Boat.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Boat.text: You will kill many, I have no doubt. But should you fall... I hope it's quick. Thank you.
Boat.context: NodeContext: authorative and grave - knows he's leaving the player to die

Lover.speaker: Danis
Lover.text: Hey! You were in the grove, right?
Lover.context: NodeContext: Panicked, frantic - speaking through prison bars

Lover.speaker: Danis
Lover.text: Yes! I was with Bex in the grove. We talked getting a house in Baldur's Gate. Have you seen her?
Lover.context: NodeContext: bex is the love of your life - terrified she's hurt or worse

Lover.speaker: Player
Lover.text: What does it matter? You'll never see her again.

Lover.speaker: Danis
Lover.text: ...I know. If - when the necromancer comes for us, tell him to take me first. Spare the others - please.
Lover.context: NodeContext: he'd do anything to protect the others, including sacrificing himself

AD_ProdigySister.speaker: Lia
AD_ProdigySister.text: Let's not push our luck any further - we should move.
AD_ProdigySister.context: NodeContext: tense  - waiting by the boat and safe for now, but that could change at a moment's notice

AD_WardenChase.speaker: The Warden
AD_WardenChase.text: The prisoners are escaping! All arms to me - NOW.
AD_WardenChase.context: NodeContext: Roaring with authority and fury

Wulbren.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren.text: What in the Nine Hells have you done? Moonrise has lost its damn mind - and we're next on the cutting block.

Wulbren.speaker: Player
Wulbren.text: In my defence, it was an accident.

Wulbren.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren.context: NodeContext: Furious. "Gaerdal" = GAIR-dul. Gaerdal is a deity, so expressed like "God help me."

Wulbren.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren.text: We need to get out of here or we're stone dead. Get us tools, anything that could crack the wall behind us.
Wulbren.context: NodeContext: panicked - desperately trying to sway player

Wulbren.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren.text: Or find a way to get this damn door open. Hurry!
Wulbren.context: NodeContext: panicked - desperately trying to sway player

Wulbren.speaker: Player
Wulbren.text: Got it - I'll be back soon.

Wulbren.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren.context: NodeContext: trying not to sound to frustrated that the job isn't done - wants player to hurry

Warden.speaker: The Warden
Warden.text: The prisoners have escaped - and the blame falls on me. I will be split open, my innards splayed before the eyes of the Absolute.

Warden.speaker: The Warden
Warden.context: NodeContext: closes eyes briefly and sighs as she accepts her fate

Warden.speaker: Player
Warden.text: I'm glad I snuck the prisoners out when I did.

Warden.speaker: The Warden
Warden.context: NodeContext: an almost hysterical laugh as the player confesses to helping prisoners escape

Warden.speaker: The Warden
Warden.text: The Absolute shines upon me. She tests me - then She gifts me you. I will now rip you apart - in Her name.
Warden.context: NodeContext: zealous, relieved - about to attack player

AD_ProdigyBrother.speaker: Cal
AD_ProdigyBrother.text: I can't stand this place. What's the hold up?
AD_ProdigyBrother.context: NodeContext: quiet and tense  - waiting by the boat and safe for now, but that could change at a moment's notice

AD_Gnome01.speaker: Nimble
AD_Gnome01.context: NodeContext: leaving the player behind to die as she hops on the boat and leaves

AD_WardenInCombat.speaker: The Warden
AD_WardenInCombat.text: Run. Beg. It matters not - this ends now.
AD_WardenInCombat.context: NodeContext: in a fight - absolutely furious with her opponents.

AD_WardenSpottedMissingPrisoners.speaker: The Warden
AD_WardenSpottedMissingPrisoners.context: NodeContext: frantic, looking through the bars, panicked

AD_WardenSpottedMissingPrisoners.speaker: The Warden
AD_WardenSpottedMissingPrisoners.text: I'll be flayed alive for this.
AD_WardenSpottedMissingPrisoners.context: NodeContext: the usually intimidating warden is terrified for herself - knows her fate for letting the prisoners escpae

Guard_002.speaker: Adept Keris
Guard_002.text: Did you request this post too? I'm glad I got the Warden and not Z'rell.

Guard_002.speaker: Adept Keris
Guard_002.text: Don't get chatty with the prisoners, mind you. The Warden won't like that.

AD_TieflingLover.speaker: Danis
AD_TieflingLover.text: We don't have time. Get to the boat, or we leave!
AD_TieflingLover.context: NodeContext: calling out to the player, who is in combat. Wants to leave on the boat and now

AD_Gnome02.speaker: Nickels
AD_Gnome02.text: Flimsy wood. Is it safe? Can it hold us?
AD_Gnome02.context: NodeContext: tense and nervous - waiting by the boat (it's briefly safe) to leave

AD_Wulbren.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_Wulbren.text: Blasted chains - keep the bastards off me!
AD_Wulbren.context: NodeContext: gritted teeth, trying to break the chains that have tied up the boat. Trying not to panic

GnomePrisoner_001.speaker: Nimble
GnomePrisoner_001.text: Wulbren is the one you want, not I.

AD_GoToTieflings.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_GoToTieflings.text: Break the wall and go - if the tieflings can't keep up, it's their problem.
AD_GoToTieflings.context: NodeContext: running through the prison, brisk tone, he's annoyed he has to free the tieflings

AD_KethericCombat.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
AD_KethericCombat.text: Take your penance - in Her name.
